fields_of_interest: General and Institutional Affairs, Economy, finance and the euro, Agriculture, Budget, Trade, Competition, Consumers, Enlargement, Energy, Environment, Taxation, Single market, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Regional Policy, External Relations, Public Health, Food Safety, Digital economy and society, Climate Action, Communication
head_office_address: Irish Farm Centre, 1 Naas Road Bluebell
eu_initiatives: All issues directly or indirectly related to Agriculture and Trade which may have an impact on Irish Farmers
section: II - In-house lobbyists and trade/business/professional associations
membership:
The Irish Farmers' Association is a member of COPA/COGECA, the umbrella organisation representing EU professional farming 
organisations and co-operatives. Through this organisation it has an extensive network and working relation with other 
professional farming organisations in the European Union
goals__remit:
Defend the interests of Irish farmers by 
 
Providing representation to Irish farmers  through  
lobbying of all European Institutions 
 
Inform its members about important political,  or legislative changes that may impact on them 
 
The Brussels office provides the primary interface with the European Institutions and its job is to gather 
intelligence on EU affairs, engage in and support lobbying efforts with the European Institutions and 
build networks with other stakeholder organisations in Brussels
